Students derive the following equation for the relationship between the distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="d minus h equals the fraction with numerator, h times, open parenthesis, lowercase m minus mu sub k, end sub, times uppercase M, close parenthesis, and denominator, mu sub k times, open parenthesis, uppercase M plus lowercase m, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mi>M</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>(b) Whether or not this equation is correct, does it match your reasoning in part (a)? (c) Students notice that the acceleration due to gravity does not appear in the equation above and assume that must be a mistake. Do you agree with them? Justify your answer.

(e) Students create the graph of net force on the block as a function of position for the block as shown above in Figure 2 but neglect the horizontal scale. If the students were to use an accurate horizontal scale, would the area under the force graph marked Area 1 be greater than, less than, or equal to the area under the force graph marked Area 2? Justify your answer.
(f) During this experiment does the angular momentum of the block-hanging object system about an axis through the center of the pulley remain constant? Justify your answer.

(g) At the beginning of the final trial, the string connecting the hanging object and the block is cut. The hanging object collides elastically with the floor and bounces vertically. Describe how high it bounces in terms of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.
